title: Adafruit IO

auth_HeaderKey.label: X-AIO-Key (HeaderKey)
auth_HeaderKey.note: The AIO Key is used to restrict or grant access to your data. The key is unique, and you can generate a key per feed, and control it in many different ways. The easiest process is to just use your automatically generated master key. You can access this key right from the right-hand side of your dashboard or from an individual feed page.

auth_HeaderSignature.label: X-AIO-Signature (HeaderSignature)
auth_HeaderSignature.note: The AIO Signature is an AWS inspired request signature.

auth_QueryKey.label: X-AIO-Key (QueryKey)
auth_QueryKey.note: The AIO Key is used to restrict or grant access to your data. The key is unique, and you can generate a key per feed, and control it in many different ways. The easiest process is to just use your automatically generated master key. You can access this key right from the right-hand side of your dashboard or from an individual feed page.

currentUser.title: Get information about the current user

createWebhookFeedData.title: Send data to a feed via webhook URL.

createRawWebhookFeedData.title: Send arbitrary data to a feed via webhook URL.
createRawWebhookFeedData.description: The raw data webhook receiver accepts POST requests and stores the raw request body on your feed. This is useful when you don't have control of the webhook sender. If feed history is turned on, payloads will be truncated at 1024 bytes. If feed history is turned off, payloads will be truncated at 100KB.

allActivities.title: All activities for current user
allActivities.description: The Activities endpoint returns information about the user's activities.

getActivity.title: Get activities by type for current user
getActivity.description: The Activities endpoint returns information about the user's activities.

allDashboards.title: All dashboards for current user
allDashboards.description: The Dashboards endpoint returns information about the user's dashboards.

allBlocks.title: All blocks for current user
allBlocks.description: The Blocks endpoint returns information about the user's blocks.

updateBlock.title: Update properties of an existing Block

updateDashboard.title: Update properties of an existing Dashboard

allFeeds.title: All feeds for current user
allFeeds.description: The Feeds endpoint returns information about the user's feeds. The response includes the latest value of each feed, and other metadata about each feed.

getFeed.title: Get feed by feed key
getFeed.description: Returns feed based on the feed key

updateFeed.title: Update properties of an existing Feed

allData.title: Get all data for the given feed

createData.title: Create new Data
createData.description:
Create new data records on the given feed.

**NOTE:** when feed history is on, data `value` size is limited to 1KB, when feed history is turned off data value size is limited to 100KB.

chartData.title: Chart data for current feed
chartData.description:
The Chart API is what we use on io.adafruit.com to populate charts over varying timespans with a consistent number of data points. The maximum number of points returned is 480. This API works by aggregating slices of time into a single value by averaging.

All time-based parameters are optional, if none are given it will default to 1 hour at the finest-grained resolution possible.

firstData.title: First Data in Queue
firstData.description: Get the oldest data point in the feed. This request sets the queue pointer to the beginning of the feed.

lastData.title: Last Data in Queue
lastData.description: Get the most recent data point in the feed. This request sets the queue pointer to the end of the feed.

nextData.title: Next Data in Queue
nextData.description: Get the next newest data point in the feed. If queue processing hasn't been started, the first data point in the feed will be returned.

previousData.title: Previous Data in Queue
previousData.description: Get the previously processed data point in the feed. NOTE: this method doesn't move the processing queue pointer.

retainData.title: Last Data in MQTT CSV format
retainData.description: Get the most recent data point in the feed in an MQTT compatible CSV format: `value,lat,lon,ele`

getData.title: Returns data based on feed key

getFeedDetails.title: Get detailed feed by feed key
getFeedDetails.description: Returns more detailed feed record based on the feed key

allGroups.title: All groups for current user
allGroups.description: The Groups endpoint returns information about the user's groups. The response includes the latest value of each feed in the group, and other metadata about the group.

updateGroup.title: Update properties of an existing Group

addFeedToGroup.title: Add an existing Feed to a Group

createGroupData.title: Create new data for multiple feeds in a group

allGroupFeeds.title: All feeds for current user in a given group
allGroupFeeds.description: The Group Feeds endpoint returns information about the user's feeds. The response includes the latest value of each feed, and other metadata about each feed, but only for feeds within the given group.

createGroupFeed.title: Create a new Feed in a Group

allGroupFeedData.title: All data for current feed in a specific group

createGroupFeedData.title: Create new Data in a feed belonging to a particular group

batchCreateGroupFeedData.title: Create multiple new Data records in a feed belonging to a particular group

removeFeedFromGroup.title: Remove a Feed from a Group

getCurrentUserThrottle.title: Get the user's data rate limit and current activity level.

allTokens.title: All tokens for current user
allTokens.description: The Tokens endpoint returns information about the user's tokens.

updateToken.title: Update properties of an existing Token

allTriggers.title: All triggers for current user
allTriggers.description: The Triggers endpoint returns information about the user's triggers.

updateTrigger.title: Update properties of an existing Trigger

allPermissions.title: All permissions for current user and type
allPermissions.description: The Permissions endpoint returns information about the user's permissions.

updatePermission.title: Update properties of an existing Permission
